item.title: How to Switch to Google Fi (2025): Plans, Tips, and Advice
item.description: Here’s everything you need to know about switching from Verizon, T-Mobile, or AT&T to the search giant’s cell service.

item.title: Wi-Fi Router Vs Mesh System: Which Is Best for You?
item.description: Find out whether a single Wi-Fi router or a mesh system makes the most sense for your home network.

item.title: VPNs and Age-Verification Laws: What You Need to Know
item.description: Age-verification laws are on the rise around the world, and VPNs promise to get around them. But do they actually work?

item.title: This Is How You Log Off
item.description: On today’s episode of Uncanny Valley, our hosts talk to features editor Jason Kehe about everything from screen time limits and the return to flip phones to the romanticization of the early internet.

item.title: How One Wikipedia Editor Unraveled the ‘Single Largest Self-Promotion Operation’ in the Site's History
item.description: A decade-long effort to boost one man’s reputation was undone in a matter of weeks.

item.title: AOL Will Shut Down Dial-Up Internet Access in September
item.description: The move will pinch users in rural or remote areas not yet served by broadband infrastructure or satellite internet. Around 175,000 households still use dial-up internet in the US.

item.title: AOL Will Shut Down Dial-Up Internet Access in September
item.description: The move will pinch users in rural or remote areas not yet served by broadband infrastructure or satellite internet. Around 175,000 households still use dial-up internet in the US.

item.title: The Age-Checked Internet Has Arrived
item.description: Starting today, UK adults will have to prove their age to access porn online. Experts warn that a global wave of age-check laws threatens to chill speech and ultimately harm children and adults alike.

item.title: Amazon’s ride on the rocket merry-go-round continues with SpaceX launch
item.description: Amazon has launched 78 of its planned 3,232 Kuiper broadband satellites.
